title: Kahoot IIKG3020 (2025) â€” Multiple choice questions (19 points)
description: Multiple Choice Questions from the wrap up kahoot in 2025. Use for practice and self-testing.

questions.question: Which of these actions is NOT a containment, eradication or recovery action?
choices: identify vulnerabilities that were exploitedidentify vulnerabilities that were exploited
confirm that the affected systems are functioning normally

questions.question: Which of these CSIRT services is a proactive service?
what is an example of an atomic indicator?
in what phase in the intrusion kill chain model is antivirus a useful course of action?
which of these incident indicators is an example of a definite indicator of an incident?
which of these threat intelligence categories is more detailed and most useful in the short term?
which of these threat actors has the highest sophistication and resource level?
Which command and control channel was most commonly used by APT1?
which of these indicators of compromise will cause the attacker most pain when you respond to it?
what comes first of these actions in the incident response life cycle?
Which CSIRT organizational model describes a team that serves a constituency belonging to other organizations?
choices: Internal combined distributed and centralized CSIRT

questions.question: What list maintained by MITRE describes common software security weakness types?
which tool is used for monitoring files for unauthorized access?
What is at the base of the hierarchy of needs for IR?
what is the most important step you can do to prepare to respond to a ransomware incident?
How can passive DNS be used in incident response?
choices: Discover associations among threat actors, track and block their activity
For sharing of indicators between CSIRTs to implement better IDS signatures
Anonymizing of IP addresses before uploading samples to Virus Total
As a sandbox for dynamic malware analysis

questions.question: what is the goal for the defender when using the cyber kill chain model?
choices: Stop the intrusion further down the kill chain
Implement courses of action right of hack
Move the detection and analysis up the kill chain
Stop the intrusion left of hack

questions.question: What is the distinction between an ATT&CK technique and an IOC?
choices: Many ATT&CK techniques are legitimate system functions, while IOCs are notMany ATT&CK techniques are legitimate system functions, while IOCs are not
ATT&CK techniques cannot be used as input to intrusion detection signatures
IOCs have less utility for defenders
IOCs are less dependent on specific malware or hacker tools

questions.question: What is DETT&CT?
choices: An update to ATT&CK, developed by MITRE
A framework assisting blue teams to map their detection coverage to ATT&CK
A scoring system for implementation of ATT&CK IDS signatures
The red team version of ATT&CK
